citeinfo.title: Palo Alto Battlefield National Historical Park Vegetation Mapping Project - Park Boundary

descript.abstract: National Park or National Monument boundary used to delineate project area. This is a vector polygon shapefile of 1992 Boundary Data for Palo Alto Battlefield National Historical Park. This data represents the boundary established by Congress authorizing the purchase of the land.
descript.purpose: To assist with the development of vegetation maps for the National Park Service.
descript.supplinf:
Boundary data were downloaded by the Colorado Natural Heritage Program/Colorado State University on 12/04/2009 from https://irma.nps.gov/App/Reference/Search and imported to the file geodatabase.
On May 8, 1846 troops of the United States and Mexico clashed on the prairie of Palo Alto in the first battle of a two-year war. Signed into law in June 1992, Palo Alto Battlefield National Historical Park preserves the 3,400-acre scene of this clash between nations and informs visitors about its national and international importance. As the only unit of the National Park Service with a primary focus on the U.S.-Mexican War, Palo Alto Battlefield also interprets the entire conflict, including the details of its origins and the broad range of consequences. In an effort to turn a scene of conflict into a place of bi-national exchange and understanding, all research and interpretation conducted by the park reflects perspectives of both the United States and Mexico.

spdom.descgeog: Palo Alto Battlefield National Historical Park

idinfo.accconst: It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from U.S. Geological Survey and National Park Service servers and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.0 (Build 6002) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

dataqual.logic: The shapefile was cleaned as a coverage with ArcInfo software before export to shapefile format. There are no duplicate features or dangling arcs/nodes present.
dataqual.complete: Data is considered complete and represents the 1992 boundary established by Congress.

horizpa.horizpar: Unknown. Intermountain Region GIS staff and PAAL staff have overlaid datasets with the boundary file. It appears that the boundary file's accuracy is acceptable as it relates to other datasets. No other tests were run.

procstep.procdesc: A coverage was created, in ArcInfo, from the AutoCAD generated file BOUDARY.DXF using DXFARC. The coverage was built, attributed and cleaned for topology.
The coverage was then converted into a polygon shapefile.
Shapefile was reprojected from UTM, Zone 14, NAD27 to UTM, Zone 14, NAD83 using the NADCON transformation method and then imported to a file geodatabase.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Park name (Palo Alto Battlefield National Historical Park)

attr.attrdef: 2-letter abbreviation of state in which park occurs (or mostly occurs if park spans more than one state)

Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.
